Name: Reporting and posting online information pertaining to mobile food vendors.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting and posting online information pertaining to mobile food vendors.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would require DOHMH to post on its website information pertaining to the number of mobile food vending permits issued for a pushcart or vehicle for city-side vending, borough-specific vending and city-wide vending specifically reserved for disabled veterans, disabled persons and veterans. Such lists would be updated at least monthly.

\pard\ltrpar\ul\f1 Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Subchapter 2 of chapter 3 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 325.2 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 17-325.2 Report on Mobile Food Vending. a. The department shall prominently post the following information on the section(s) of the department\rquote s website relating to mobile and temporary food vendors:\par
(i) the number of mobile food vendor licenses issued to individuals;\par
(ii) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for pushcarts pursuant to section 17-307(b)(2)(a);\par
(iii) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for vehicles pursuant to section 17-307(b)(2)(a);\par
(iv) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for pushcarts pursuant to section 17-307(b)(2)(b), disaggregated by borough;\par
(v) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for vehicles pursuant to section 17-307(b)(2)(b), disaggregated by borough;\par
(vi) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for pushcarts pursuant to section 17-307(b)(3)(a); and\par
(vii) the number of full-term mobile food permits issued for vehicles pursuant to section 17-307(b)(3)(a).\par
b. The obligations of the department under this section shall be continuing and the department shall ensure that all information provided pursuant to this section is accurate and current. At a minimum the department shall update such information on a monthly basis.\par
\pard\cbpat1\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\f0\'a7 2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment.\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\par
